title: How Many Calories in a Green Apple?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a green apple, including full nutrition breakdown like protein, carbs, fiber, and quick tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Green Apple?
assumptions: Medium-sized green apple (e.g., Granny Smith, ~182 g), raw, with skin, no added toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by variety, size, ripeness, and growing conditions. Check labels or apps for specifics when available.

quick_answer.text: A medium green apple has about 95 kcal and 4.4 g fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Small apple (~125 g) instead of medium

faqs.q: How many calories in a green apple?
faqs.a: About 95 kcal for one medium green apple.

faqs.q: Are green apples lower in calories than red?
faqs.a: Similar—both around 95 kcal per medium apple; green may have slightly more tartness but comparable nutrition.

faqs.q: How much fiber in a green apple?
faqs.a: Roughly 4.4 g per medium apple, mostly from the skin.

faqs.q: Do green apples have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Very little—0.5 g protein and 0.3 g fat per medium apple.

faqs.q: Does apple size affect calorie count?
faqs.a: Yes; small apples ~69 kcal, large ~116 kcal. Adjust based on weight.
